com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.server

Interface ServerStart

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Launch, Loggable, MultipleConnections, NetworkInterface, SoftStoppable

    public interface ServerStart
extends SoftStoppable, MultipleConnections, NetworkInterface
    This interface describes the Server-side of NetCom2.

    As most other components, this interface has an implementation, that is hidden for different Reasons.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.1
    See Also:
    ClientStart

    • Method Detail

      • at

        static ServerStart at(int port)
        Creates a new ServerStart at the provided port.

        This is the only way currently of creating a ServerStart.

        You may however feel free to create your own.

        Parameters:
        port - the port, the Server shut letch onto
        Returns:
        a new Instance of the ServerStart

      • acceptAllNextClients

        void acceptAllNextClients()
                   throws ClientConnectionFailedException
        Calling this Method will block, until the Server is shutdown or until an exception occurs.

        This method is accepting all Clients. While doing so, this call blocks.

        If you want to use this method in an non-blocking way, use the NetCom2Utils.runLater(Runnable) or NetCom2Utils.runOnNetComThread(Runnable) method.

        NOTE: If you extract this Method into another NetComThread, most of the Time, your Program will just exit. The NetComThreads are daemon threads, which means, that they will not stop the Program from exiting if they are still running. A best Practice would be, to use your own Thread to extract this.

        By default, this is the main Way of using the ServerStart. If you require some Work between each client connection, use the acceptNextClient() method, which only accepts the next client.

        An ClientConnectionFailedException will be thrown, if the Creation of the Client fails or any ClientConnectedHandler throws an Exception. The last one will result in an stop of the whole Server, to allow you to fix the issue.

        Throws:
        ClientConnectionFailedException - if anything goes wrong while a Client connects
        See Also:
        acceptNextClient()

      • acceptNextClient

        void acceptNextClient()
               throws ClientConnectionFailedException
        Accepts the next Client tha connects.

        This Method-Call will block, until the next Client is connected. You will use this, if you need to doe some Work between each Client connection.

        An ClientConnectionFailedException will be thrown, if the Creation of the Client fails or any ClientConnectedHandler throws an Exception.

        Throws:
        ClientConnectionFailedException - if anything goes wrong while a Client connects

      • getPort

        int getPort()
        Returns the current port of the ServerStart.
        Returns:
        the port this ServerStart uses

      • setPort

        void setPort(int port)
        Sets the port of the ServerStart.

        Allows you, to set the Port, even after the ServerStart has been created. If you need to change the port after the ServerStart is created, use this.

        Parameters:
        port - the port the ServerStart should letch onto

      • addClientConnectedHandler

        void addClientConnectedHandler(ClientConnectedHandler clientConnectedHandler)
        Adds an ClientConnectedHandler, that should handle a newly created Client.

        Those ClientConnectedHandlers will be asked 2 times. First to create the Client-Object and second to handle this Object.

        Parameters:
        clientConnectedHandler - the Client ConnectedHandler that should be usd

      • removeClientConnectedHandler

        void removeClientConnectedHandler(ClientConnectedHandler clientConnectedHandler)
        Removes a ClientConnectedHandler from the ServerStart.
        Parameters:
        clientConnectedHandler - the ClientConnectedHandler

      • distribute

        Distributor distribute()
        Returns an Distributor instance, to Distribute without knowing the specific Session of the Client.

        This Distributor is used, if you want to send something to multiple Targets.

        For most other needs, you should use the Session, that is injected into the OnReceive handlers or use the ClientConnectedHandler

        Returns:
        an internally maintained instance of the Distributor
        See Also:
        Distributor

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Shuts down the Server and disconnects all connected Clients
        See Also:
        SoftStoppable.softStop()

      • setServerSocketFactory

        void setServerSocketFactory(Factory<Integer,ServerSocket> factory)
        Sets the ServerFactory, that is asked to produce the ServerSocket

        If you want to use SSL, you may provide an Factory, that creates an SSLServerSocket.

        Parameters:
        factory - the Factory, that should be used.

      • clientList

        ClientList clientList()
        Returns the internally maintained ClientList.

        This may be used, if you need to get a certain Client or apply something to all Clients.

        If you however want to access certain Clients, it is recommended, to create a custom UserObject and set the UserObject, aggregating the Session of the Client inside of an custom ClientConnectedHandler. The Client is an real representation of the Connected PC. Therefor you can do real, irreversible damage at runtime, resulting in an fatal, unrecoverable error.

        Returns:
        the ClientList

      • setExecutorService

        @Experimental
void setExecutorService(ExecutorService executorService)
        Sets the ExecutorService, to be used internally
        Parameters:
        executorService - the ExecutorService.

      • remoteObjects

        @Experimental
RemoteObjectRegistration remoteObjects()
        Returns an internally maintained RemoteObjectRegistration.

        This is used, whenever the Client requests a RemoteObject using the RemoteObjectFactory

        Returns:
        a unified instance for the RemoteObjectRegistration
        See Also:
        RemoteObjectFactory
